medical_history.chief_complaint: Multiple cutaneous neuromas and macular amyloidosis associated with medullary thyroid carcinoma.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 45-year-old Caucasian woman, first noticed numerous papular lesions at age 22, with an increase of 2 to 3 lesions per year. She also observed macular lesions on her back 2 years prior to presentation. The lesions were asymptomatic and showed no history of chronic pruritus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a euthyroid nodular goiter with a dominant nodule of 1 cm over the left lobe and had a mutation within exon 13 of the RET proto-oncogene. Histopathology revealed two foci of medullary thyroid carcinoma.
